text: English producer A. G. Cook has released two studio albums, one extended play and twelve singles. In 2012, Cook released the classical style piano album Disklavier Concert 1, with fellow labelmate Danny L Harle, Spencer Noble and Tim Phillips, under the moniker "Dux Consort". In 2013, Cook released the album Lifestyle with labelmate Danny L Harle, under the moniker "Dux Content". He also released his debut EP Nu Jack Swung. Cook would not release another full-length project until 2020, where he released his two debut studio albums, 7G and Apple. Cook is perhaps best known for his work with English singer Charli XCX, of which he has produced many songs with, as well as served as executive producer for her two studio albums Charli and how i'm feeling now. Cook has also produced for the likes of Jónsi, Caroline Polachek, Hannah Diamond, Li Yuchun, among others. == Discography == ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" ! scope="col" rowspan="1" style="width:12em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="1" style="width:16em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| 7G | * Released: August 12, 2020 * Label: PC Music * Formats: digital download, streaming |- ! scope="row"| Apple | * Released: September 18, 2020 * Label: PC Music * Formats: LP, digital download, streaming |} === Extended plays === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" ! scope="col" rowspan="1" style="width:12em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="1" style="width:16em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| Nu Jack Swung | * Released: July 31, 2013 * Label: PC Music * Formats: digital download, streaming |} === Singles === {| class="wikitable" !Title !Year !Album |- !scope="row"|"Keri Baby" (featuring Hannah Diamond) | rowspan="4" |2014 | rowspan="2"| PC Music, Vol. 1 |- !scope="row"|"Beautiful" |- !scope="row"|"What I Mean" | rowspan="3" |- !scope="row"|"Bubs" (with Oneohtrix Point Never) |- !scope="row"|"Drop FM" (featuring Hannah Diamond) | 2015 |- ! scope="row" |"Superstar" |rowspan="2"| 2016 |rowspan="2"| PC Music, Vol. 2 |- ! scope="row" |"IDL" (as Life Sim) |- ! scope="row" |"Money On A Gold Plate" / "Cos I Love U" |2017 |Month of Mayhem |- !scope="row"|"Lifeline" |2019 | rowspan="4" |Apple |- !scope="row"|"Oh Yeah" |rowspan="3"| 2020 |- !scope="row"|"Xxoplex" |- !scope="row"|"Beautiful Superstar" |} === Remixes === {| class="wikitable" !Title !Year !Artist |- !scope="row"|"Odyssey, Pt. 2" | rowspan="4" |2013 |Dreamtrak |- !scope="row"|"B.
